item.title: Opened Quetion Powered by Natural Language Processing
item.description: Unleashing the Power of Open-Ended Questions in Surveys: A TextProbe Perspective In the realm of survey research, the debate between open-ended and close-ended questions has long been a topic of discussion. Over the years, numerous studies have highlighted the richness of responses garnered from open-ended questions, contrasting them with the more constrained nature of close-ended queries. Authors such as Comley (1996), Gonier (1999), and Kwak and Radler (1999), among others, have underscored the depth and spontaneity of insights derived from open-ended surveys conducted through email and web platforms.
